column4: i somehow messed it up, and now only get grub rescue> on boot
Any error message before the rescue prompt?

I somehow destroyed my install of mint, I orignally had a dual booting win7 + winXP and then I installed Mint-linux too, grub took over. It worked fine, until I selected some kind of recovery partition causing grub to mess up. Now I am presented with "error: uknown filesystem." and "grub rescue>", anyone can help me fix it?
Can you run boot info script, http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1291280 , and pastebin the output?
First please give us the boot info script results
I got "no such file or directory"
In a terminal type "sudo bash ", then drag the script into the terminal window, then press enter to run it.
I'm going to need to leave in about 10 minutes.
ok then, what should i look for in the results?
Looks like your partition numbering changed, and /dev/sda7 became /dev/sda6
so how would I fix this?
http://grub.enbug.org/Grub2LiveCdInstallGuide should get grub working again. Make sure that when you run grub-install you point it to /dev/sda *not* to a partition /dev/sda6 .
You need to follow that guide to use grub-install from a liveCD, it won't work without either chrooting as explained in the link I gave or using --root-directory. I recommend chrooting.
